Further building on the success of the Dolphin transporter, the Pleco is a result of a joint effort between Atreus Shipbuilding Currents and Stellar Shores Shipping to develop a mid-size TM-type vessel. Though using the same grav-harness docking technology as most TMs, the unique hull form and docking arrangement of the Pleco allows it to carry no less than six parasite fighters, giving it a distinct edge in offensive capabilities compared to its peers, despite its poor speed. Coupled with the characteristically sturdy Boron shielding, the Pleco makes for a far more dangerous opponent than its spindly appearance and unassuming name might suggest.

One of the largest ships found in Terran space, the Pioneer-built Kagawa is a freighter vessel of truly mammoth proportions. Rivaling the Terran Asgard battleship in sheer size and mass, the Kagawa features one of the largest cargo-handling capacities found anywhere in the Gate Network.\n\nFollowing the reconnection of the Althes and Megnir jumpgates, and the ensuing massive military and humanitarian efforts to secure those sectors against Xenon assault, the engineers of the Pioneer Initiative were tasked with preparing an ultraheavy transport vessel capable of ferrying enormous amounts of humanitarian supplies or necessary war materiel that might be needed if a route was discovered to the final lost colony of Aldrin. The advent of Project Genesis terraforming efforts expedited development of the Kagawa, with the sheer scale of resources demanded by the terraforming process promising a steady demand for such large transports.

As the first highly-anticipated combat-line product launched by the post-shutdown reconsolidated Jonferson Space Dynamics Division, the Mk3 Centaur is a dramatic return to the ship's roots as a fast, aggressive corvette-class striker. Designed in a bid to produce a ship capable of matching or exceeding the capabilities of the venerable Terran Katana, the ship boasts a formidable array of forward weaponry, good all-around turret coverage and fighter-like agility, though this comes at the cost of a light-duty hull structure and somewhat mediocre overall protection. \n\nWith the newly-reformed company holding a tenuous financial position, it was a deliberate decision by Jonferco designers to recall the classic Argon design in a bid for a knockout market entrance. Though the Centaur fell somewhat short of the impossibly lofty expectations set upon it by Jonferco executive leadership, the ship proved a commercial and military success, being well liked by its users and earning a particular popularity with the semi-independent Special Action Task Forces of the Argon and Antigone navies.

The product of a joint Argon-Teladi venture to produce a new generation of cheap defence drone following the Gate Reconnection, the Universal Standard-Armaments Semi-Autonomous Fighter Drone - more commonly referred to as the Commonwealth Standard defence drone, or simply the Standard - is a massive commercial and military success that can be found both in service and available for sale throughout every corner of settled space. \n\nThough the design has begun to significantly show its age in the modern battlespace and brings very little in the way of individual combat power, decades of design maturation and manufacturing refinements have driven the cost of the Standard down to practically nothing, letting even the most cash-strapped freighter captain freely deploy them in bulk as disposable countermeasures against pirate attack. This has ensured the continued popularity of the Standard despite its perceived obsolescence in frontline military use.

Little is known about the Xenon defence drone beyond the proven fact that it is tactically superior to any of its counterparts. Beyond being larger, more robust and having better armament, Xenon AGI systems also ensure the drone is smarter and meaner than any other drone system. A swarm of Xenon drones can swiftly bring down an underprepared foe of any size and present a formidable obstacle when contesting battlespace control of Xenon-occupied systems.

The modern incarnation of Terran Keris defence drone is a powerful and advanced semiautomonous weapons system. Though somewhat slower than its Commonwealth counterparts, the Keris presents a reduced target profile and possesses superior armament in the form of a standard Terran Pulse Cannon.

Designed in a bid to reduce casualty risk to fighter pilots, the Krill defense drone is a very agile drone armed with a single Ion Gatling. \n\nAccording to Boron fleet doctrine, correct usage of the Krill drone in a coordinated fleet action sees it deployed in large numbers alongside manned fighters, using its physical presence to distract enemy fire and the engine-disrupting properties of the Ion Gatling to pull apart enemy formations, thus allowing crewed fighters to deliver decisive tactical strikes in relative safety.

A highly conventional application of Split combat philosophy, the Split-designed Skink defence drone is extremely fast and mounts a deadly Tau Accelerator as the main weapon system, giving it an unexpected edge in combat when facing larger targets.

As much a product of cultural dogma as one of military necessity, the Paranid Cupid defence drone was initially designed by the Holy Order to both provide their forces with a combat advantage and to free their captains from the perceived shame of relying on the heretical Standard drone. The Holy Order enjoyed a brief period of drone superiority before the design was acquired by the Godrealm, which swiftly adopted the system and began to field their own copy. \n\nArmed with a scaled-down version of the Paranid Railgun system, the Cupid gives Paranid forces a unique form of offensive support.

Unable to easily gain possession of high-tech capital ship weapons, pirate engineers designed the Incendiary Bomb Launcher as an easily producible alternative. With the name being in use for nearly a century, each iteration of the IBL is based on the design of a contemporary weapon and shares little in common with its predecessor, aside from the basic mode of operation and effect on target. The modern IBL is essentially just a massively scaled up and mildly deconstructed Plasma Cannon, hurling massive balls of high-energy plasma that destabilize and explode on impact. This explosion deals significant damage across a wide blast radius and momentarily leaves behind a burning reside that can damage the hulls of shielded targets, though the unstable nature of the projectile somewhat limits the IBL's effective range compared to similarly sized weapons.

Curiously, neither of the IBL's secondary effects are intentional- in a bid to reduce the power demands of the weapon, a variety of features dedicated to safety and reliability were stripped from the Plasma Cannon design, though the negative effects of such a move are clearly of little interest to the pirates.

Size: SMALL
 Weapon Class: BOMBER

The Incendiary Bomb Mortar is a miniaturized version of capital-sized Incendiary Bomb Launcher. Just like the larger counterpart, the IBM throws unstable plasma projectiles that explode on impact and briefly leave a burning residue that can damage the hull of a shielded vessel. While it offers a remarkable amount of firepower for its size, the lack of a capital-grade power supply drastically limits the projectile's maximum range and velocity.

As its name suggests, the Yaki Burst Ray turret incorporates the same phased-wavelength technology found on the standard fixed-mount Burst Ray. Much like the progenitor technology, the Burst Ray turret deals extra damage against exposed hull and surface components, and can partially bypass active shield layers, though this comes at the cost of a reduction in maximum effective range- a tradeoff deemed necessary in order to enhance their raiders' ability to swiftly overwhelm and disable targets when making forays through hostile space.

The Yaki Rail Slugger turret is a straightfoward modification, mounting a Paranid-designed Rail Slugger onto a medium-class turret mount. Though it has extremely poor tracking capability, the weapon boasts a best-in-class effective range and lethally fast projectiles, giving Yaki raiders an extremely effective armament to harrass targets while on the offensive or covering rear arcs to deter pursuers.

Scale Plate pirates have long been rumored offer a premium to employ Teladi builders for remote jobs, only to commandeer their vessels after the work is complete. While the majority of these captured construction ships are swiftly broken up for scrap to turn a quick credit and recoup costs, recent shifts in internal culture of the Scale Plate Pact have resulted in a different fate for some of the vessels. The growing trend of organization and cooperation among Pact pirates has led to the emergence of pirate warlords, commanding of large fleets of roaming marauders seeking to leave their mark on the galactic stage. In an apparent bid to recall the old legends of pre-shutdown pirate might, some captured Albatross builders have resurfaced as massive pirate scavenger-carriers, heavily modified but clearly recognizable, serving as flagships for the most successful pirate warlords. Dubbed the Galleon, these ad-hoc warships are a rare sight despite the proliferation of the Pact- a testament to the difficulty of procuring such a vessel given the unruly nature of pirate warbands and the significantly limited resources available to the pirates. \n\nWith its primary purpose being to visually demonstrate the power of their warlord-captains, the Galleon eschews defensive measures, with only modest shielding for its class and no point defense emplacements. In exchange, the ship boasts one of the heaviest armaments of any Commonwealth vessel: a formidable battery of 12 large turrets, often fitted with an eclectic loadout of whatever was on hand at the time, supported by abundant internal hangar space and numerous small ship landing pads. Beyond it's own capabilities, a Galleon is also inevitably accompanied by a full warband of pirates- motley swarms containing any number of attending vessels of all sizes. The arrival of a Galleon-led Warlord fleet presents a grave threat to any civilian or military asset in the system, and those few examples that are successfully wrested away from pirate control are jealously guarded trophies.

Another revived design borne of the increasing cooperation within the Scale Plate Pact, the Blastclaw bomber is a remarkably capable ship and is a common sight in among larger pirate flotillas, both escorting larger vessels and operating as an independent strike wing. \n\nThough rather slow, the ship is well-shielded and features a heavily reinforced hull. However, the true strength of the bomber lies in the Incendiary Bomb Mortar mounted under the cockpit, capable of rapidly blasting away exposed surface elements and weakening shielded hulls. Even a single Blastclaw poses a deadly threat to poorly defended freighters, while a sufficient number of them can even challenge and disarm a destroyer, leaving it disabled and vulnerable to boarding actions undertaken by larger ships.

One of the larger threats in regular use by the Scale Plate Pact, the Brigantine is a heavily armed capital ship that can pose a significant threat even to military forces. Found almost anywhere that Scale Plate pirates operate and fulfilling any role demanded of it from solo raider to warband leader, the ship's pervasive presence in pirate fleets is owed primarily to its relative ease of acquisition. As many observers have concluded from it's appearance, the Brigantine is cobbled together by pirate shipwrights using the hull sections of Teladi auxiliary ships and carriers- scavenged from battlefield wrecks, decommissioned hulks and even the occasional captured prize. As with the Galleon, rumors abound of the Scale Plate Pact employing less overt means of acquiring these hulls through independent purchasers or unscrupulous Teladi officials, though the Teladi Company vehemently denies the rumors as slander and the Pact remains characteristically cagey with its secrets. \n\nIn the battlespace, the Brigantine employs a typically mismatched grab bag of weaponry and shielding, with the pirates making up what they lack in sophistication and planning with enthusiasm and sheer volume of fire. A handful of docking pads and launch tubes- remnants of the original ships that make up the hull- allows the Brigantine to deploy and support a small wing of fighters or drones to bolster its already-formidable firepower, while cavernous cargo capacity alleviates any need to be picky with plundered loot. Even the sheer imposing size of the vessel offers another weapon in the form of a menacing intimidation factor against civilian freighters. However, the design has numerous flaws as well- the nature of the Brigantine's construction leaves it with a weak hull structure for a ship of its size, a problem made worse by the relatively limited shielding and subpar speed. The substantial armament is also widely distributed across the hull, leaving few blind spots but in turn greatly degrading the ship's ability to concentrate fire on a target.

Another of the Scale Plate Pact's homegrown designs, the Marauder corvette was first created in an act of desperation by a mechanically inclined Pact captain whose Minotaur Raider had been crippled in a raid gone awry. Though he managed to limp back to a hidden freeport, survival was only the first of his problems. Financially destitute, with a shattered ship and a crew on the verge of desertion, the captain - one Iljorgawas Minanoros Ioannis XII - noticed that although the central section of his Minotaur was little more than twisted scrap, the critical forward control and the aft machinery sections were still mostly intact. Struck by a flash of inspiration, he managed to cajole a little more faith from his crew and spent the next several days cutting out the damaged central section of his ship and reconnecting the two remaining portions. A few modifications later, he and his crew once again headed out in what would become the template design for the Marauder. \n\nAs the smallest medium-class ship currently found in the Gate Network, the Marauder specializes in attacking smaller foes while running from larger ones with its good agility and comparatively high speed. A varied collection of armaments - a pair of M-class fixed mounts, a single M-class turret, and four S-class fixed mounts thrown in for good measure - gives the ship good striking power against small transporters or enemy fighters, while the surprisingly capacious cargo storage for its size allows SCA freebooters to haul home their spoils. In exchange, the poor shielding, somewhat questionable hull strength, and anemic armament for its weight class leaves the ship with unfavorable odds when facing other corvettes or even a particularly ornery heavy fighter pilot. Nonetheless, its low operating costs and cheap construction price(often made cheaper through the use of written-off Minotaurs, like the original) ensure its place as a mainstay among the Scale Plate Pact pirates.

page.title: Xaar's Faithful
page.t:
Cut off from the Empire's leadership, and with much of the local religious structure lost in a freak navigational accident, the Paranid inhabitants of Wretched Skies spent much of the Shutdown building an unusual bond of blood with their Split neighbors through constant violent clashes. 

Strangely, the influence of the Split had something of a stabilizing effect on these leaderless Paranid; rather than descending into madness or despondence, the Paranid of Wretched Skies rallied around a new doctrine that combined scattered elements of the traditional Paranid mythos with the brutal tenets of Split culture. Once the Gates reopened, this earned them the respect of the Split Patriarch, but also the enmity of both the Godrealm and the Holy Order, a position which is held mutually by the Faithful. Unlike the Holy Order, they are much less concerned about the heresies of the "lesser races" and maintain generally nonhostile, if somewhat chilly, relationships with most other Commonwealth powers. 

The fanatical beliefs of Xaar's Faithful are simple, straightforward, and impossibly heretical to the larger Paranid factions. According to the Faithful, the continued absence of Paranid Prime from the known Gate Network is no mere accident. They hold that the Priest-Emperor has shrouded the system from sight, biding his time in the darkness between the stars as a trial laid upon all Paranid, and that he someday will return to lead the Paranid people once more: embracing those who remained devoted, rewarding those who took up arms in his name, and cleansing all apostates with holy fire. As was decreed fitting of their position as subservient to the Priest-Emperor, no Paranid of Xaar's Faithful may hold a title above Deacon, and thus Xaarist affairs are generally directed by the "Deacon Triumvirate" - a triplet of councils representing the dogmatic pillars of Belief in Xaar, Force of Arms, and Mundanity of Life.

page.t: The well known and respected NMMC Trade Guild is always looking for skilled and proven traders to bolster our ranks. You have caught our attention and we wish to extend this invitation to you. If you are interested, please meet with me.

The path to profit often is a treacherous one, with both natural and artificial obstacles along the way. We at the NMMC Trade Guild believe that a proactive stance is needed to both protect our assets and clients as well as discourage any heinous acts against us.

Those who wish to make a profit can never help the natural and artificial obstacles that may stand in their way. That, however, does not mean that these obstacles cannot be overcome, and we believe that an active approach to dealing with these obstacles is necessary to protect both our assets and our clients.
We need a number of pilots to go out and deal with a number of potentially dangerous situations.
We are looking for experienced pilots capable of dealing with these problematic issues.
The NMMC Trade Guild is looking to expand its operations and influence in the local area. To do so, we must find opportunities to expand and act on them.
A stagnant operation is an unprofitable one, which is why the NMMC Trade Guild is looking to expand our presence in a number of areas.
A trusted business partner is requested to help us identify such opportunities and potentially provide assets to take advantage of them.
We need a versatile and skilled partner to act in the interests of the NMMC Trade Guild to help us in this endeavour.

An organisation as large and far-reaching as the NMMC Trade Guild will often run into mundane issues which limit its profitability. Should these issues never be addressed, it may well lead to financial loss. This is unspeakable.

We at the NMMC Trade Guild pride ourselves on managing a vast network of traders and leading them to profit. That said, we recognise that minor issues do occur which lead to reduced profit or even a loss.
We need a resourceful pilot to look into such issues and solve them so that we can guarantee hassle-free profit for our members.
An adaptable and skilled pilot is required to help us get a handle on these issues so that we can ensure continued profitability.
Our influence on the market goes far beyond simply ensuring our stations remain stocked and our traders remain active. We are of course here to turn a profit and we will do so by a number of means.

Running such a large and profitable organisation such as our own is a testament to our prowess in trade and management. It also highlights that our many strategies continue to work and bring in additional credits.

Controlling the price of goods with supply and demand is a time-tested technique to maximise our gains in this area. We require a NMMC Trade Guild member to perform a number of tasks to help shift the market in our favor.

Manipulating supply and demand to control the prices of goods works well to maximise our profits. To this end, a NMMC Trade Guild member should perform a number of tasks to help shift the market in our favour.

Intelligence is key to making sound business decisions, especially when that intel concerns your competition. It is also imperative that we keep an eye on our ships to ensure their safety and that they are not taking part in nefarious acts which could lead the Guild itself into disrepute.

Argon and Teladi share an old adage in that knowledge is power; in this case, the power to make a profit for one and all. In order to make the best possible business decisions, it is very important that we keep two eyes on both our competition and our own ships, as often as we can spare them, in order to ensure a broad and deep view of the current situation.
We need a pilot to help expand our sensor network in the local area.
We are looking for someone to help expand our sensor network to this endeavour.

Once an intelligence network has been built, it is vital to the operation that it is maintained, so that we can always have an ear to the ground and ensure not only that our competition remains behind us, but also that our members remain out of trouble.

We are keen to ensure that the vast intelligence network that we have already built is also properly maintained. This will allow us to keep an eye out for any new developments both within our own organisation and for our competition.
We seek a pilot who can help with this maintenance on our sensor network.
We are looking for someone to help make sure our sensor network is well maintained.

Some say that profit thrives in a warzone, and they are not necessarily incorrect, but there is little profit to be found for a trader that has a weapon pointed directly at them. The universe remains a dangerous place, and in order to ensure the safety of our assets and our clients, these dangers must be dealt with accordingly.

Though a lot of steps have been taken since the Jump Gates began to realign to ensure a safer and more peaceful life for all, there are still many dangers across the Jump Gate network. Not only for the sake of our profit, but of course for the sake of our and our clients safety, we must make sure that we deal with these dangers.
We are looking for pilots who feel like they can tackle these dangers, should they be in the form of Xenon incursions, pirates or other, more threatening menaces.
We would like someone to help us deal with these dangers, whatever they may be, without risking a loss of profit.

All economy stems from the natural resources that exist across the Jump Gate network. To give our members and clients the best start to their economic activities, we'd like someone to use resource probes to find strong resource regions in $SPACENAME$. Specifically, you should look for the following resources: $WARENAMES$

We would like to see an increase in the number of natural resources available for us, and in order to do that, we first want to prospect profitable regions. We'd like you to use resource probes in $SPACENAME$ to find strong yields of the following resources: $WARENAMES$

Many of our traders have been complaining about their trade routes being blocked by mines lay down by pirates and their competitors in recent times. We would like someone to deal with these mines so that our traders can go about their business in peace.

We are looking to improve our trading fleet with a new freighter. We have spent significant time looking into areas where we are falling flat and have identified an exact specification for this ship, and would like you to source it for us:\n$FLEET$

As part of our work to improve our intelligence network, we would like you to help build up our satellite network in an area of interest to a number of our members' competitors. This will allow our members to keep a better eye on the competition, and build trust in the NMMC Trade Guild.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

We have identified an area of space that shows a lot of potential to be a popular trading point in the near future. We would like to give our members as much of an advantage as possible, and so would like satellites to be placed in the area so we keep an eye on development and tell our members when the best time to start investing will be.

After a number of Xenon incursions and raids as of late, some of our members have asked us to ensure that their stations are kept safe. We take the safety of our members' assets very seriously, and would like to ask that laser towers be placed around some member stations to show that we are willing to help.

A number of our satellites have been broken by weapon-fire, accidental collisions and of course deliberate attacks and sabotage. As part of the maintenance of our network, we ask you to fly to these satellites and repair their hull to $PERCENTAGE$%.

A number of our members' stations have been suffering from a number of data leaks. This is not only harmful to our members but can also lead to significant problems for us, so we would like to ask that the leaks be dealt with in a timely fashion. We trust you to take care of this for us.

One of our courier pilots has reported that they were forced to drop a number of items while en route to one of our stations. A lot of Credits were paid for these items, so we need you to first find the crate that the items were dropped in, then recover the items for us.

This operation is more sensitive than most: To keep you safe, we will only tell you what you are required to know. We need you to board a station belonging to one of our member's competitors and make your way to the control rooms. From there, it is imperative that you quickly and quietly sabotage the station by hacking into its control panels. Good luck.\n$REQUIREMENT$

One of our courier pilots has got themselves trapped in a mine field and we need someone to lure the mines away from them. The mines should only be detonated if it is sure that our courier will not come to any harm. Once the mines are out of the way, the crew has instructions to resume their flight.

One of our couriers has been caught in a mine field. Though they were able to eject from the ship and pilot themselves to safety, the ship requires recovery. Please board the ship and clear the mine field, then plot a course to the designated station. There you can transfer ownership of the ship back to us.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

One of our members has placed an open request for some items that they seek on our notice board. It is not of very high priority, but if you find yourself with time to spare, you could help us by finding these items and taking them to the pilot. We are sure they would be very grateful for the work.

page.t: The Jonferco Trade Guild is looking for skilled and proven entrepreneurs to join our organisation and you have been flagged as a prime candidate. If you would like to discuss this further please come and meet me.

At the Jonferco Trade Guild, we try to make it as easy as possible for our members to enjoy trading without interruption. Unfortunately, the Jump Gate network is full of both natural and created obstacles, and we must take an active approach to protect our members from them.

Those who are members of the Jonferco Trade Guild like to enjoy trading with as little interruption as possible. We take a proactive approach to providing this, dealing with any natural and created obstacles quickly and effectively, so that our our members may focus on what is important to them.
We are looking for someone to go out into space and deal with a number of potentially dangerous situations.
We are looking for those who can help us by dealing with these kinds of problematic obstacles.

We at the Jonferco Trade Guild are ambitious, and ever looking for ways in which we can expand our operation to help even more traders make money. To this end, we must of course seek out new opportunities and act upon them.

To make sure we are serving our members as best we can, we must always keep moving forwards and look to grow our operation where we can. In order to do this, we are looking to expand our presence in a number of different areas.
We need a skilled and versatile businessperson to help us identify the opportunities we can use to grow and potentially provide assets in order to take advantage of them.
We are looking for a trusted business partner to act towards these interests, potentially providing assets to the Jonferco Trade Guild, so that all members might gain from them.

The Jonferco Trade Guild, much like the Jonferco Space Dynamics Division, is built on people helping each other, even with the most mundane of problems. These problems, should they never be tackled, might cause problems for us all further down the line.
We recognise that our Guild is not yet at the same level as the NMMC Trade Guild, we strive to one day be better, which means learning to manage small problems before the grow and become unsolvable.

We look to solve such problems as quickly and effectively as possible, and we are seeking resourceful pilots to help us in this endeavour. This will help ensure convenient trading for all of our members.
We are looking for an adaptable and resourceful pilot to help us solve such problems quickly and efficiently so that all of our members can continue their endeavours and help us to grow.

At the Jonferco Trade Guild it is our highest priority to make sure our members and all of their assets stay in business, and ideally also profitable. To achieve this, it is sometimes necessary to go the extra mile, beyond keeping our member stations in stock and making sure our members can trade at all.

Sometimes in order to keep our members in business and profitable, our number-one priority at all times, it is necessary to use techniques other than keeping our members' stations in stock and giving our members suggestions on where and how to get the best deal.

Controlling the price of goods by removing or adding a ware from the market in bulk not only allows us to ensure our members make a good profit on their trades, but also protects the economy against potential future collapses. We are looking for an Jonferco Trade Guild member to help us with tasks relating to this goal.

A commonly-used technique for ensuring long-lasting profits is to manipulate the supply and demand of goods and thus to control their prices. This doubles somewhat as ensurance against potential economic collapse. We're currently looking for one of our members to perform a number of tasks to help shift the market in this way.

We are only able to do our work because of our vast and still growing intelligence network. It allows us not only to keep an eye on economic trends, but also to keep an eye on our competition when it is necessary, as well as working as an early-warning system when our own members reach trouble.

A lot of hard work has already gone into building our intelligence network. One of our greatest assets, it means we can know in advance if one of our members gets into trouble, we can keep an eye on our competition where we find it necessary and of course can quickly identify economic trends worth our members' attention.
We are looking for a pilot to help us further build and expand on the sensor network already in place.
In order to keep us up to date, we seek a pilot who will further build and expand on our sensor network.

It is not much use to build an intelligence network without then maintaining it. It is key to our Guild that this is done, so that we can continue keeping an eye out for market changes that may help our members, as well as helping us to keep an eye on our competition and keep our members out of trouble.

We wish to make sure that our intelligence network is not only expanded, but also properly maintained. This will allow us to notice quickly any changes to the economy that are of interest to our members, as well as enabling us to keep an eye on our competition and to make sure our own members stay out of trouble.
We are looking for a pilot who can help with this maintenance on our satellite network.
We need one of our members to help make sure our sensor network is well maintained.

As an organisation, our main objective is to ensure stress-free trading for all of our members, and this is difficult to achieve when there are so many threats across the Jump Gate network. We need to ensure the safety of our members and their assets, and to do that these need to be dealt with.

The Jonferco Space Dynamics Division has been one of the driving forces behind creating a safer and more peaceful Jump Gate network, but there remain many threats that have yet to be dealt with. The Jonferco Trade Guild recognises these threats as a danger to its members, and realises that these threats must be dealt with.
As such, we ask that a willing and able member of our Guild help us in tackling some of these dangers, whatever they may be.
To help us in this endeavour, we would like a willing and able member of our guild to deal with some of these threats.

To help our members who are interested in mining, we would like to find some local high-yield regions that we might share with them. We'd like someone to use resource probes to identify profitable mining spots in $SPACENAME$. Specifically, the resource probes should be used to find: $WARENAMES$

We are looking to expand into more mining activities, and would like to see a number of profitable regions in the area prospected to help us with this. We need you to use resource probes in $SPACENAME$ to find strong yields of the following resources: $WARENAMES$

We've been informed by some of our members that they have been held up by mines being placed at Gates and highway entrances along their trading routes, no doubt placed by pirates or their own competition. We would like you to deal with these mines so that our members can go about their business in peace again.

To deter some pirates lingering near our trade routes, we placed a couple of cheap mines. Knowing those pirates, the mines are probably good enough to do some damage to their ships and keep them from making trouble. However, the next inspection from Jonferco bureaucrats will reveal, that the mines' software licence is long expired. To avoid paying a fee for using outdated and potentially dangerous technology, we want you to destroy them.

We are looking to grow our own merchant fleet with the addition of a new transporter. After significant work to analyse what exactly it is we need, based on areas where we feel we are falling short, we have identified an exact specification for this ship. We would like you to source it for us:\n$FLEET$

A number of our members have expressed an interest in knowing more about what their competitors are up to. We see an opportunity here to broaden our intelligence network, and so would like you to deploy a number of satellites in an area that we've identified as of interest to our members.

Sources tell us that one particular trader, not a member of our Guild, has the potential to significantly damage trading routes for not one but many of our members. We would like to be able to analyse the situation for ourselves, so we require a satellite to be deployed in the specified location.

A number of our members have been suffering from raids on their stations recently, as well as an increased number of Xenon incursions. The safety of Jonferco Trade Guild members and the security of their assets is one of our top priorities, and as such we would like to see laser towers deployed around the affected stations.

Be it from stray weapon fire, accidental conditions or deliberate acts of vandalism or sabotage, a number of our satellites have been taken out of commission. As part of the maintenance to our network, we'd like you to fly to these satellites and repair their hull to $PERCENTAGE$%.

A number of our member stations are suffering from data leaks that are leaking very sensitive trading information, not only to our competition, but potentially also to pirates. We can't allow this data to be used harmfully - we need the leaks dealt with in a timely fashion.

A member of the Jonferco Trade Guild was attacked while they were on a trading run, and reported to us that they were forced to drop some of their inventory to make sure it wasn't destroyed. The pilot is fine, at least physically, but unable to retrieve the items. Instead, we would like you to find the crate in which the items were dropped in, and then recover them on our behalf.

We don't usually condone these kinds of operations, but the matter is urgent and needs to be dealt with quickly and quietly. For your own safety, we will only tell you what you need to do. Without asking questions, please make your way to the designated station, board it and make your way to the control rooms. Once there, please use the appropriate equipment to... temporarily disarm the specified panel. Thank you and good luck.\n$REQUIREMENT$

One of our members found a mine field on their trade route and attempted to traverse it instead of going around. They are now stuck in a field of tracking mines. In order to rescue the pilot, we would like someone to lure the mines away from the ship. Be careful: The mines should only be detonated once it is certain that the pilot will not come to harm. When the mines have been cleared, the pilot knows to resume their flight.

One of our members has been caught in a minefield they were trying to traverse on their trade route. Once stuck, they were able to eject into a spacesuit and navigate out of the field, but the ship has been stranded. We'd like it to be returned to its owner. Please board the ship and clear the mine field, then plot a course to the station we've designated. There you can transfer ownership back to us.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

page.title: Atreus vs Strongarms War
page.descr: Texts for the 'Atreus-Strong Arms war' mission-group and sub-mission variants
page.t: The Strong Arms, a rival company of the agressive Split race, continues to test our borders. We are looking for trusted friends of the Atreus Currents to help keep them in check.

The Strong Arms grows more bold and desperate with each passing day and we must show them that the Atreus Currents will not tolerate any incursions into our space. We are looking for volunteers to help us enforce that stance. If you believe you have the skills and fortitude, sign up!
(Mail Title)$FACTION$ - Recruiting Volunteers Against the Strong Arms
The Strong Arms again seem to be massing on our borders and we must be ready to deal with them.
The remains of our intelligence network in Strong Arms space points to them preparing their forces.
Like before, the Strong Arms continues to underestimate our resolve and preparedness.
Our intelligence links and recon ships confirm a build up of military assets in Strong Arms.
It looks as though the Strong Arms is once again preparing for a skirmish into our space, massing a number of ships on our borders.
What remains of our intelligence network in Strong Arms space points to them preparing forces to make another push towards our territory.
While we continue to press the Split Strong Arms to reign in their agression, we must remain vigilant and prepare for any outcome.
The Strong Arms believes they have the upper hand but we will be sure to have our defences ready should they try their luck. We're looking for able bodies and minds to help us in this endeavour.

Time is short on us to make preparations. Defences are a priority and we're looking for independent contractors to coordinate with us in maintaining our existing countermeasures as well as deploying new ones.
The Strong Arms continues to underestimate our resolve and preparedness, as they have many times before. They are readying for a move into our space, but they will not get their wish.
Our intelligence network and reconnaisance vessels confirm a build up of military assets in Strong Arms space adjacent to our territory. We believe they are readying an 'invasion'.
Should they come, we will meet them as we have before and hold this sector with ease. We must of course be cautious and ready for whatever they throw at us.
We will coordinate with all local forces, corporations and any willing civilians to be sure that everyone is prepared. Will you join us in the defence of our people?
The Strong Arms once again prepare to test us. Reports talk of many combat ships, from scouts to capital-class destroyers, stocked for days of conflict, massing on our borders.
We reach out again as the Strong Arms prepare to test our already battered defences with newly built or prepared combat ships, armed to the teeth as always.

Our forces are stretched to a point where we must begin driving forward with the construction of new ships and defensive structures. Our shipwrights are hard at work putting together effective and capable warships while our engineering corps continue to build and maintain our static defences.
Any aid in these areas is much needed. We are looking for able individuals prepared to invest significant resources and effort in preparing our space for anything the Strong Arms will throw at us.
While we only have a short window to shore up our defences, we expect any help in these areas will play a key part in future engagements with the Strong Arms.
The Strong Arms once again prepare to engage against us. They expect that we will bend and break under the force of their newly built fleets, but we know they're coming, and now we can prepare.

Scouting and intelligence reports talk of Strong Arms ships massing at the Jump Gates leading towards our territory. As to be expected, it looks as though it is a strong offence, but when we know it's coming, we can prepare appropriately.
While our warships and static defences have proven themselves time and time again, we will continue to strengthen them in the face of aggression from the Strong Arms.
We are looking for able individuals to aid us with significant time and resources in preparing our defences against anything the Strong Arms can throw at us.

With reports stating that the Strong Arms are building up their forces and rumours of war spreading like the plague, we have decided to take action. We assume that when the time does come, our defences will not be the only thing targeted.

We stand on the brink of another conflict with the Strong Arms and must take action if we are to survive yet another onslaught. When the time comes, we must make sure we are ready for the worst case scenario.
We must be sure to safeguard the resources vital to our operations. This involves finding and protecting raw materials as well as stocking up whatever wares we are currently short on.

The Strong Arms continue to make it difficult for our freighters to do their work effectively, but with the aid of pilots like you and the rest of the Atreus Currents defense forces, we will get our infrastructure running smoothly - so we can get back to dealing with the Strong Arms aggression head on.

This conflict has put a sizable strain on our infrastructure and supply lines, leaving us with slow construction projects and the onset of rationing. We will not let this continue, but we require the skills of all able pilots to help us reverse the situation.

The Strong Arms will soon attempt another strike at our territories, according to all trustworthy reports. Though it has not always been the case, we must assume they have learned from prior mistakes and will target more than our defences if they wish to destroy us.

Another day, another feeble attempt by the Strong Arms to break our defences and our spirit. Reports indicate that they are preparing another attack, and we will be ready for them to attack not just our fleets and defences, but, desperately, our civilian structures as well.

As we press forward against the Strong Arms, we must continue to guarantee that our economy continues to function smoothly. This will include protecting our supply lines and mining areas as well as searching for any new sources of raw resources.

The Strong Arms are looking to make it difficult for our freighters but with the aid of pilots like you and the rest of the Atreus Currents forces, we will continue to keep our economy running smoothly so we can focus on dealing with the Strong Arms aggression head on.

The intelligence network we have managed to set up in Strong Arms territory has reported back that they are preparing yet another attack against us. We have decided to change our tactical response, in an attempt to change our fortune.

You have no doubt heard the rumours, or seen for yourself; the Strong Arms is massing combat ships on our borders. We fear another assault on our territory, soon, and wish to take them by surprise in order to get the upper hand.
Given our position, we are looking to find and strike low risk targets in the hope that it can draw the Strong Arms's attention from the fronts where our forces are stretched.
We expect that neutralising these targets will not only destabilise the cohesion of the current enemy forces, but will also give us a decisive edge when we are ready to counter.

While the Strong Arms have forced our hand, we do believe that striking these targets will help turn the tide back in our favor. At the very least, it will give the Strong Arms something to think about.

Once again our intelligence network has come through for us! We now know that the Strong Arms is preparing another offensive against us, and our tacticians have already started planning our counter attack. We want you to take part!

We have known for some time that the Strong Arms would try to push their luck, as they have many times already. Our tactical teams are forever working to find new ways to embarrass the Strong Arms , and we are confident in this new plan.
As we continue to strengthen our position in our space, we must prepare for the next phase of the conflict with the Strong Arms.
Before we commit a large number of our forces to the front, we first want to remove some strategic targets in order to destabilise the enemy defences.
While some signs point to the Strong Arms planning another offensive against us, we lack the intel to be able to deploy our defences effectively.
In recent weeks we have been working with nought but rumour as we try to get on top of the Strong Arms's plans. We believe they are planning a new offensive.

Intel has been a shortcoming for us so far in this conflict. We have made preparations to improve the situation but it will require skilled individuals to work alone and potentially behind enemy lines.

What intel we do have indicates that the Strong Arms continues to be overconfident and often stretch beyond their means. With improved intel, we should be able to launch strikes when they are at their most vulnerable.

Our intelligence division is confident we can plug what gaps we have in our network and give us an edge on the Strong Arms when we choose to strike. Of course, it will also aid us in protecting our borders against whatever they choose to throw at us.

While we continuously push the Strong Arms, we do not expect a quick solution to their agression. This has left our intelligence community with a lot work to do in a short amount of time with limited resources.

It might have been quite easy for the Strong Arms to push straight through it were it not for our continuously impressive preparations; preparations we must continue to make if we wish to continue fighting the Strong Arms. For this, we will use our greatest assets.
Throughout this conflict, we have proven that our intelligence division is much more capable than anything the Strong Arms has. In order to move forward, we must continue to press this advantage.
We are looking for trusted individuals to put their skills to use against the Strong Arms on their home turf. These tasks are not without risk but they will certainly help us maintain the upper hand.
As most likely know, we have been caught off guard several times in our conflict against the Strong Arms, allowing them to make advances on several fronts.
We have commenced operations to drive them out of our territories, but this will be a prolonged struggle.

We need skilled pilots to aid in achieving our objectives. These will include backing up combat units when pushing the enemy back as well as holding out critical areas as we continue to rebuild our defences.
Thanks to the hard work of our people and allies, we find ourselves in a prime position to deal a heavy blow to the Strong Arms.
They are currently on the back foot and we must continue to press them and hinder their ability to launch any form of aggression.
We are looking for brave and skilled pilots to help us ramp up the pressure. The situation is very volatile and tasks will shift from attacking enemy positions to defending our own.

We cannot just sit idly by as these zealots expand their reach further and further. If we do not act decisively, and soon, we might reach a point where we cannot resist their advances further. Taking the fight back to their territory is our top priority.

We have received troubling reports that the Strong Arms fleet is gathering its forces. Command is worried that if they decide to start a full scale invasion, we have little to put in their way. We need to inflict massive damage in order to divert their efforts away from readying their fleet.
It is crucially important to hit one of their stations hard. It is the most sure-fire way to stem their expansionist efforts. The fighting will be intense, and we have to expect losses on both sides.

We are fighting wars on several fronts, and our resources are starting to run low, so we decided to take the slightly unusual step of hiring outside help for this task. You will be well compensated if you take down this station on our behalf.

The odds might be against us right now, but we Borons are a tenacious people, and we will fight them with everything we've got. If you help us in our battle, we will be eternally grateful and pay you well.

Thanks to an increase in supplies and recruiting efforts, we are ready to start an advance into Strong Arms Space. Our intelligence officers have identified a potential target station which, if eliminated, will weaken the hold these Split freaks have over the territory.

The fighting so far has been fierce, and we are ready to escalate the conflict even further. If we mean to win this war at some point, we have to make meaningful progress, and we are confident that we can beat them back.
Our intelligence officers have identified a potential target station that, if eliminated, will significantly slow down these fanatics.

This offensive is of significant importance, which is the reason why we turn to you. It will take a considerable amount of preparation, and there will likely be heavy casualties, but this will be reflected in the reward we are willing to pay if you succeed.

While there are others working on building larger military installations to help in our defence, many areas still lack smaller defences such as laser towers. These require placing in areas that are vulnerable to enemy attack.

Given our current level of intel, we gauge there are only a few places that the Strong Arms can launch an effective attack from. One of these areas is not in our space, but we feel it imperative to reinforce any potential entry point. We require a number of mines to be placed in this strategic location.
Mine our borders to Strong Arms space

As you may well know, we share a border with the Strong Arms, which makes that entry point an incredibly important strategic location. As part of our defensive plans for that area, we require a number of mines to be deployed there.
As part of our push to secure our resources from the enemy, we would like you to place defensive laser towers at strategic points in resource-heavy regions that are critical to our economy.

At the request of our intelligence division, we require a single satellite to be placed in a vital area. We not only want to gain sensor data for that region, we also want to bait the Strong Arms into some response. Anything we can do to dictate their movements or reveal their strength will aid us when we have to make a move ourselves.

Though our main priority in this area is to keep an eye on the movements of the Strong Arms, a sensor grid is necessary to track any potential threats to our space. We are looking for you to fill the holes in that net.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Several of our ships are in need of minor repairs and to help take the strain off of our shipyards, we are looking to make as many in-space repairs as possible. As the crew continues to repair the internal systems, we require additional help for the hull and external sub-sytems.

A number of specialists on Strong Arms tactics and history are to be transported to strategic locations to give direct assessments of our preparations. We require a number of pilots to come forward to provide safe and swift transport for these clients.
We are requesting a new military installation to be built in a strategic location to help us deter aggression from the Strong Arms. We will require the facility to fit the following specifications.

In order to plan future operations against the Strong Arms, we would like to gauge what resources they have available to them in their space. Attempt to find high yield regions of the following resource: $WARENAMES$
(next ID reserved for gender)Take out Strong Arms Agent

(ma target)We have identified a key player involved in several acts of espionage against us and our allies. $NPCName$ has been spotted posing as an entrepreneur on several of our stations while he meets with known Strong Arms sympathisers. Unfortunately for him, the last one he met with is on our payroll.

(fe target)We have identified a key player involved in several acts of espionage against us and our allies. $NPCName$ has been spotted posing as an entrepreneur on several of our stations while she meets with known Strong Arms sympathisers. Unfortunately for her, the last one she met with is on our payroll.
(ma target)\nThey were last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Make sure he doesn't come back from this one.
(fe target)\nThey were last seen flying a ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Make sure she doesn't come back from this one.

(ma target)During one of our last engagements with the Strong Arms, one of our ships was lost. It seems that some of the wreckage was salvaged by the individual $NPCName$, who then went on to sell sensitive data pulled from the ship's databanks. Our contacts believe he is soon to contact another buyer and we must stop him from making the exchange, by any means.

(fe target)During one of our last engagements with the Strong Arms, one of our ships was lost. It seems that some of the wreckage was salvaged by the individual $NPCName$, who then went on to sell sensitive data pulled from the ship's databanks. Our contacts believe she is soon to contact another buyer and we must stop her from making the exchange, by any means.
(ma target)\nThey're flying ship: $SHIPID$. Don't let him go any further.
(fe target)\nThey're flying ship: $SHIPID$. Don't let her go any further.

We have determined a certain Strong Arms ship to be a prime target for a data-extraction operation. The ship must be engaged, boarded and its data-core cloned for us to analyse. The information contained in that ship may be decisive in the battles to come.

The time has come to make an offensive push to remove the Strong Arms from this sector. We have full confidence in our fleet and our pilots, but they will require some support as they fight. We would like you to provide this support for us.

To greater improve our chances of striking back against the Strong Arms, we are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) to take command of our ships. These pilots should be brought to one of our stations before the fighting starts.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

To make sure that our military installations are performing at peak efficiency during the war against the Strong Arms, we are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) to be brought to one of our stations.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

You cannot win a war without a fleet. Our shipyards are working at full capacity, but in order to bolster our numbers, we require the support of independent suppliers. To help in the war-effort, please bring the following ships to our headquarters:\n$FLEET$
We need to keep the production running and need your help in fulfilling the open trade-orders. Try to get above the specified minimum storage threshold.\n\nMinimum storage level: $STORAGEPERCENT$%
(singular)Track down a ship matching the following specification and destroy them.$SPECS$
(plural)Track down ships matching the following specification and destroy them.$SPECS$

Atreus Intelligence is supporting a splinter cell of the Strong Arms to gather intel and disrupt the Order's administrative capabilities. Our aid consists of water transports to feed the cell's workforce. However, Intelligence recognised a small but unexpected increase in the Strong Arms's population, and is now concerned about the cell's loyalty. Thus, the last deliveries have been marked with an isotope. To confirm that our resources are not being used against the Atreus Currents, Intelligence requests scans of Strong Arms ships transporting Water.

Since the Strong Arms seem to be unwilling or unable to deal with its aggression any time soon, the Atreus Currents is initiating the appropriate steps to contain these sadistical pirates and secure our trade and our borders. To this end, Atreus Intelligence suggests an evaluation of their access to Hull Parts. These numbers tell us how much firepower we have to bring along in order to turn their ships, stations, hopes and dreams into space dust. To aid Intelligence in their evaluation, provide scans of Strong Arms ships transporting Hull Parts.

To locate security breaches within their ranks, the Strong Arms set up this minefield and leaked its location to specific branches of their military command. Targeting it diverts their counterintelligence from our agents.
This minefield is an obstacle to a manoeuvre our captains might want to execute. Strategic Planning thus requested it to be removed before a battle takes place in its vicinity.

There are a couple of laser towers that would expose nearby undercover ships executing a mission. We have to assume that they lack knowledge of these towers. Additionally, we cannot warn them as the communication attempt would uncover them. To ensure their success, we have to take out the towers.

One Strong Arms strategist is quite incompetent, yet he is a candidate for promotion. We do our best to make it look like his predictions are correct, to encourage them to promote him. Lately, he suspected that we would target a specific group of laser towers.
This is a critical task. You will be operating in Strong Arms territory, so expect heavy resistance. They certainly won't take this lying down. We need this station to be destroyed completely.

We have become aware that an important Strong Arms dignitary is going to be assigned to a station within our reach. We are going to send a team of experienced marines to infiltrate the station, and snatch him up for intel. A basic kidnap job. Unfortunately, the ships equipped for such an incursion aren't well suited to weathering strong defensive fire. So, before we can set this plan in motion, we need you to destroy the turrets that would prevent our crew from getting close.

Station: $STATION$
Amount of turrets to destroy: $TURRETS$

page.title: Strongarms vs Atreus War
page.descr: Texts for the 'Strongarms vs Atreus war' mission-group and sub-mission variants
page.t: Wretched Boron refuse to back down. Their insistence on opposing subjugation can only be met with open war. Split are looking for capable individuals to aid with Boron annihilation. Reinforce borders. Lead attacks on their turf. Split can offer a variety of duties for you to tend to!
Split always in need for volunteers to help fight Boron. Enlist, if you feel you are up to task. Demonstrate skill, engage Boron!
(Mail Title)$FACTION$ - War Against the wretched Boron
Ever since Gate reconnection, the Boron Atreus Currents and Split Strong Arms have clashed. Split foresee enemy military campaign, and must be prepared to counter-attack.
Though cowardly Boron are hard to predict, Split worry about a possible imminent attack. Need to be prepared.
Boron keep interfering in Split affairs. Split respond in kind, inflict casualties, and push them back. Atreus seem to insist on witlessly repeating their grave mistake.
Split vanguard spotted Boron bordering Split space. They seem unaware of our presence, or severely underestimate Split strength. Either way, they will soon regret foolish action.

Boron ships occasionally slip through our defensive perimeter from both sides, to escape imprisonment or run operations in Split sectors. Intolerable! If Split do not react, control over the territory will be lost.

The Atreus Currents has proved surprisingly resourceful. Again and again, they send troops into Split space. Inflict massive damage. Split need to shore up defences, or Boron campaign will continue and families will challenge Patriarch's control.
Split identified several defensive weaknesses. To address them immediately is very important.
Boron cannot be underestimated. Split must be well prepared. Once their ships are kept outside Split territory, Split families can coordinate effort to beat Boron down.
Split need protection from Boron raids. To not guarantee it would dishonour the Patriarch. Once Split space is securely under control, Split again turn attention toward crushing Boron.
Boron ships throw themselves against Split defences with little effect. At great cost they hope to wear Split down. Desperate measure, but it might pay off eventually if Split grow complacent.

Split and Boron fought in glorious combat. Many of theirs dead. More taken prisoner. Split can expect the Atreus Currents to mount desperate attempt to bring them back, so it is safe to assume an attack will follow shortly.
They are pathetically predictable. Knowing that they will attack again gives Split severe strategic advantage.
It is a concerted effort of several families. You, too, can help Split improve our defences. Decisive action will see Boron vessels ground to particles.

While Split families bicker, Boron is united. Very much puts Split on back foot. We need to strengthen our fleet and defences. Not only so can oppose Boron military, but also to intimidate families, and in turn ensure obedience.

Recent losses to Boron assaults have caused internal strife. Families start to doubt Patriarch's might. Some might say Split leadership's strategy was too offensive, and neglected to safeguard home front. A bolstered fleet and improved defensive structures should keep everyone in line.

This project demands Split full attention. Boron threat cannot be underestimated or put aside any longer. Fleet has to demonstrate strength. Has to kill all who oppose Patriarch's might. Stations must to be testimony to military superiority.
Anyone who can contribute to Split goal of defensive supremacy is invited to join effort.
Timely response is critical, so Split turn to outside help. Any assistance in these key areas could be what tips war back in Split favour.

Boron continue to suffer heavy casualties on the battlefield. Their Navy's losses brings shame upon the Atreus Currents. Recent pathetic performance gives Split enough room to fortify current position.

We proud warriors show time and time again that all who oppose Split families die. Boron have not yet taken lessons to heart. Keep coming, keep dying. Split have to seize current advantage to fortify defences and expand fleet.
While the enemy still reels from defeats, Split have to act. Our cause to drive back Boron and destroy any who oppose Split requires position of strength.
Split looking for servants willing to provide the significant time and resources needed to help complete a number of large construction projects.
Should you be experienced in ship or station construction, Split encourage you to contribute to war effort.

Split Patriarch so preoccupied with battle plans and waging war, that lesser things are left unattended for longer than perhaps they should. Resources are running low. This neglect could prove fatal if not addressed.
Resources are running out. Split families grow restless, and frustrated. Families need resources to fuel war effort, otherwise no way to contest Borons' current advantage.
Waging war is essential to Split way of life. Unacceptable to allow industry to grind to a halt. Those responsible will be punished. Split must secure supply lines to factories and shipyards.

Our patrols report an increased Atreus Currents presence, and escalation in slave revolts take noticeable effort to smother. In combination with already severe resource shortage, these new developments force Split on our knees. Split need to lay groundwork for new resource extraction.

It is not only Boron Split must worry about, but also internal struggles. To keep families amenable, Split need to provide stability through secured supply lines. Procurement of resources is of crucial importance.
Expansion of Split space going very well. Boron struggling to keep up fight, backing down like weaklings they are. But, rapid expansion puts stress on existing supply lines.

Boron are losing majority of direct confrontations. That is why they changed strategies. Instead of nobly fighting combat fleets, they engage Split freighters and miners in pitiful attempt to weaken economy. Split protect as much as Split can, but supply deliveries have to be dependable.

Well-functioning economy crucial to ability to wage war. As such, Split would be foolish to disregard its importance. Split need to secure supply lines and mining areas as well as open up new sources of raw resources.
Split offer several assignments meant to safeguard supply lines and relieve economic stress. If you have the facilities to help, Split command you to take up task!

Atreus Currents is unrelenting in their attacks. Split need to step up offensive operations, and take fight to them. These operations, no matter how small in scale, will take pressure off of Split. Allow for coordinated counter-incursion into enemy territory.

The Boron have amassed a vast number of ships and resources, and are intent on pushing into our territory. It is only matter of time. We need to initiate a preemptive attack to soften their blows, before they launch the invasion.
If Split hit key military targets, Boron might change approach, or slow down assault. Then, Split have chance to improve defences or mount a meaningful large scale counter attack.

Split do not understand the way wretched Boron wage war, but some behaviours are universal. Split hit hard enough and Boron have no choice but to shift efforts away from attack to defence. Split in need of valiant warriors, capable of disrupting Boron enough to trigger reaction.

Caution is advised. Sometimes, even Split cannot engage enemy in direct combat. To divert enemy efforts away from attack, Split need to fall back on ambushes, and hit-and-run tactics. Only way to minimise losses and maximise damage.

Split demonstrate military prowess again and again, leaving shattered ship wrecks floating in our wake. Every skirmish won, chips away at Boron resources. Split cannot allow taking off pressure now. Hits must come fast - and frequent.

Split families have always valued offensive approach to war. Split not yet ready for large scale invasion into Boron space, but still, effort has to be made to keep up pressure. Constant assaults will keep Boron on the defensive while Split prepare serious campaign.
Any blows dealt to the enemy will help Split efforts in the long run. Gives Split time to prepare next big push into Boron space.
If you are experienced Pilot, serve Split effort to disrupt enemy operations. Get behind enemy lines and see them cower in fear of next attack. Break Boron will to fight as well as their ships.

An unexpected encounter with Boron ships resulted in Split scout responsible for gathering intel being shot down. Result is Split now blind to enemy movement. Unacceptable. This loss has set back Intelligence Agency, and Split need to bring intelligence network back up to be able to react to Boron movement.

Amount and quality of intelligence gathered by Split officers is severely lacking. Patriarch troubled by inadequate coverage of Atreus Currents ship movement. Efficiency of Split raids depends on precise information.

Solid information to act on allows Split to set ambushes and inflict critical damage to Boron war effort. Split not wait for enemy to come for Split. Split kill enemy, but only if we know their movement.

Boron minds seem weak-willed compared to Split. In open combat, Split tear them apart. But the Atreus Currents is cunning, and if Split not careful, they trick us. We need more information to better understand their strategies and movement.

Split identified several tasks crucial to improving intelligence network. Some require work behind enemy lines, and even direct interaction with the Atreus Currents. Risky, but fearless warrior will prevail.
Pilot accepting these assignments will operate in enemy territory. Direct conflict possible. Reason why the Patriarch seeks experienced warriors for these tasks.
Split pushed back wretched Boron. They hide in safety of own territory, recovering. Preparing fight back. Split cannot let up now, need information on their plans to keep upper hand.
War is going well, but intelligence is outdated. If Split want to snuff out Boron for good, Split are dependant on reliable information.
Split have resources and plans to improve intel, and if plans are implemented, result will be be increased efficiency in battle.
Reliable, honourable servants are needed to execute these tasks. The improved intelligence network will see Split enemies ground to dust!
This war has shown Boron to be worthy adversaries. They advanced on several fronts. Split families fight back vigorously, but enemy is taking considerable grounds from us.
Split families have come together to fight back, and reclaim what was ours. Boron will surely match Split ferocity. Split expect long-winded campaign and many dead.
Now Split request help from all who are able to aid us. Support Split driving the wretched Boron out of our space. Shed their blood. Protect our combat units. Defend critical areas.
Due to Split warriors' determination and sacrifice, and allies such as yourself, Split are in position of strength. An opportunity presents itself to seize Boron space. Split hunt them down.
This invasion will not win us the war, but taking their territory will put Split in position of significant advantage. Result will be space for families to expand into and fortify.
Split seek driven and skilled warriors to join in conquest. Tasks include linking with combat wings to attack their positions as well as defend ours.

Hard to admit, but currently Split warriors are outmatched. They lack resources to properly defend territory against Atreus Currents. Boron can afford to coordinate and gather their strength for impressive feats of war, and all Split can do is react.

Split have lost a considerable amount of ships on raids into enemy territory. Gaining hold in heavily fortified space is an issue, even for mighty Split warriors. Reason for grave humiliation is a specific station supporting Boron fleet in that space.
If Split not change way this is going, consequences will be critical. Split need to hit Atreus Currents hard. Only possible solution is destroying station.
It is a monumental undertaking, and only the most valiant warriors will pull it off. But, it will give Split time to recover. Split will also be able to gain ground in conflict.
Right now situation is dire. Should a valiant warrior be up to the task of wrecking Station, this victory might give push to Split families, and mobilise them into attacking.

Split warriors so superior to Boron scum that right now Split push into several enemy fronts successfully. Split are looking to conquer Boron sector, and drive the weaklings out. Best way to go after them is to destroy their structures.

Families are fighting united. Patriarch is demanding blood of Split enemies. Soon, Boron space will belong to Split. We are looking to do critical damage to their sector control. Split spent enough time shooting down ships, now Split go after their stations.
If Split destroy Boron station, Atreus Currents could lose control of supplies and manufacturing. Or they might be open to all out attack on sector, without defence.
This task only suitable for the most trusted, powerful allies. It will be great challenge, but success will be met with a reward even greater.

Split warriors require sustenance. If food ever runs out, families will assuredly rise up to overthrow Patriarch. If Atreus Currents is smart, they will eventually try to starve Split out. Split must be prepared. Supply provisions so Split warriors remain content.
Well-stocked armoury is mandatory for besting enemy. Supplies needed to build ships and equipment are in danger of running low. Split require pilot able to bring these resources.

Split always working on complex defensive structures, but basic defensive measures cannot be neglected. Several regions in Split space still lack fundamental defence. Tasks like setting up laser towers might not bring the rush of a good fight, but need doing. So do them.

Split need to secure entry points to Split families' neighbouring sectors. Boron regularly send assault teams to sabotage supply lines. Mines will make access to Split space more dangerous. Drop Mines at strategic access points.

Boron slaves are becoming more and more defiant. Many try to make a break for Boron space in hijacked ships. In response, Split plan to install mines at sector entry points. Will not return escaped slaves, but their deaths will likely deter potential imitators.

The Atreus Currents has been eyeing Split regions rich in resources. We will not allow anyone to tap Split space, least of all our enemies. Deploy laser towers to protect areas critical to Split economy.

Split cunning! Split identified area Boron frequently travels through. Split plan to deploy single satellite. But, Split not only want it deployed for enemy visibility, but also to bait Boron into ordering a convoy to stop and take it out. Then, we ambush Boron and take them out.

Split want sector to be scattered with satellites. It will help Split be prepared for Boron attacks, but that is not the only purpose. Additional benefit is keeping eye on Split families the Patriarch suspects might revolt. If Split can spot insubordination before they pick up momentum, Split can deal with them easily.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Your task is to place Satellites in enemy space. Split aware that satellites will not last long. Eventual destruction acceptable, as long as Split get picture of current enemy movement.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Conflicts with Boron often leave our ships severely damaged. While Split prioritise fixing most grievous issues in shipyards, Split are looking for pilot to help fix minor damage to hull and external sub-systems in space.

You have honour of transporting famed Split fighters to front. Heroes upholding the name of Patriarch have killed hundreds each. They will first train undisciplined Split grunts on front line before joining the fight. We require many pilots for this special delivery. Make sure valiant warriors arrive safely.
Split recognise value of an impenetrable defence. Patriarch has decreed a station be built in specific location to protect families from Boron invasion. Specifications as follows:

Split always looking to expand into enemy space. Once Split snuff out Boron fleets and drive survivors out of sector, Split must immediately get to work. Defence stations need to be built to secure position. Split need to know what resources are available in enemy territory. Find high-yield regions of the following resource: $WARENAMES$

(male)Split realised that one valiant Boron warrior has been responsible for many sullied family names throughout this conflict. Split cannot tolerate this dangerous enemy to live unpunished. Split want him dead.

(female)Split realised that one valiant Boron warrior has been responsible for many sullied family names throughout this conflict. Split cannot tolerate this dangerous enemy to live unpunished. Split want her dead.
(ma target)\nHe was last seen flying ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Kill him.
(fe target)\nShe was last seen flying ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Kill her.

(male)$NPCName$ recently supported a slave revolt. He helped slaves escape their bonds and supplied them with a ship. Slaves made for Boron territory. Occasionally this happen, but most times Split capture or kill them before they vanish. Not so this time. With $NPCName$'s help they slipped our reach. This story is now inspiration to other captives. Split want him killed, as demonstration that no one ever interferes with Split affairs without facing consequences.

(female)$NPCName$ recently supported a slave revolt. She helped slaves escape their bonds and supplied them with a ship. Slaves made for Boron territory. Occasionally this happen, but most times Split capture or kill them before they vanish. Not so this time. With $NPCName$'s help they slipped our reach. This story is now inspiration to other captives. Split want her killed, as demonstration that no one ever interferes with Split affairs without facing consequences.
(ma target)\nHe was last seen flying ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Kill him.
(fe target)\nShe was last seen flying ship with ID: $SHIPID$. Kill her.

Split command wants to own Boron ship to analyse its technology and decode its military encryption. Only reliable way to get hands on ship is a boarding operation. Restraint is not a strength of Split military. Chances of target ship being destroyed completely, if engaged by Split fleet, is very high. That is why Split give task to you.
Split have privilege of shedding blood for sector control. We demand our allies to support our offensive in whatever way possible.

Split in need of pilots. Many capable veterans lose their lives on the battlefield every time Split engage enemy, and it hard to find replacement. Split not want incompetent pilots in their ranks, but high turnover sometimes leaves little choice. So, Split ask you to find suitable people to fight in war.
We are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) to undergo provisional tests for Split rapid-response program.
$DESTINATION$
$SKILLS$

To ensure military installation functioning in times of war, Split are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) to be brought to Split station. Experience in maintaining weapons systems mandatory.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

Split always plan expansion. An increase in conflicts with Atreus Currents assured. In anticipation, Split ask you to help out in fleet production, as Split shipyards always run at capacity. To aid war effort, bring following ships to $SECTOR$ :\n$FLEET$

Several families have grown increasingly restless, as the war with Boron has begun to impact their supply lines.
