State of Split economy has a direct impact on ability to manufacture offensive fleets, so Patriarch has agreed to assign a number of servants to help families stockpile resources.\n\nThe station related to this task requests that their resource levels are raised above: $STORAGEPERCENT$%

Split want to thin out Boron Navy. If you come across ships of certain type, shoot them down indiscriminately. Purpose of this project is to demoralise Boron pilots. No one wants to be potential next target.\nKeep eye out for Boron ships with following specification:\n$SHIP$

Split believe we have found weakness in enemy Boron ship hulls. If Split can confirm observations through scan, findings might increase combat efficiency significantly. Scan enemy ship to determine validity.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$

Split want to initiate new invasion. To formulate new campaign, Split strategists need to evaluate several stations to determine best way forward. Split are looking to cripple economy in bid to deliver critical blow to Boron. Scan potential target station to aid Split decision.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$

Split adept at manufacturing weapons and combat ships, but lack efficiency in other industries. It would be beneficial if Split could get hands on any information regarding Boron station modules. Split can likely reverse engineer technology.\n\nSplit need the following module scanned: $MODULE$

Spies learned of Atreus Currents plot to send ships into Patriarch's territory to free slaves. From radio message Split intercepted, the only indication of which ship they plan to send is what ware it is currently hauling as a deception. Split now want database of all potential ships to look out for.\n\n Find an Boron ship containing: $WARE$

An Boron commander recently fled the battle when Split overran his forces. As a matter of principle, this weakling cannot be allowed to live. According to Split intelligence networks, the commander has been spotted in a new ship, trying to escape our reach. Locate this ship for Split so we can dish out punishment for dishonourable conduct. The ship in question has ID code $IDCODE$

Split hear rumours of Boron improving their ship hull manufacturing process. Critical to know what Split are dealing with, and how to upgrade current arms setup in response. Best way to gather intel on the subject is to seek out ships supplying stations with manufacturing materials. Scan Atreus Currents ships carrying hull parts so that Split know what Split are dealing with.

Split running low on materials that are necessary to sustain war effort. Now, Split have to open up new resources to keep going. Could take immense effort to locate, and time is something Split cannot afford to lose. Split would rather focus attention on drafting battle plans. If Split could identify locations that Boron mine for ore, Split could tap existing sources once Atreus Currents has been displaced. Easiest method is to identify ships carrying ore and retrace travel path back to source. To do that, all you have to do is scan ships transporting ore.

Split manufacturing stations in need of labour. Split set on raiding Boron stations to obtain new work force. To be efficient, Split need to identify easy targets with a sizeable population. Any station with a large number of inhabitants requires basic natural resources, like drinking water. If Split can keep track of how many necessities are transported to which station, Split can extrapolate population, and identify suitable target station. Help gather data by scanning ships transporting water.

Split identified Boron minefield that will make advancing Split fleet needlessly difficult. Would make things significantly simpler if it were cleared before advancing. Seek out minefield and destroy mines.

In their desperation, Atreus Currents keeps deploying mines in hopes of inflicting casualties on Split. It is rare that reckless Split fighters fall for it. Even so, these mines should be taken care of to give Split more space to manoeuvrer. Remove them swiftly.

Last raid failed catastrophically due to Split not taking into account laser towers. During retreat, Split fighters flew into waiting arms of towers. Massive casualties. Split have to learn from this humiliation, and ensure that repeat mistake is impossible.
Split are planning incursion into Boron space. Troops ready to go, but scouts spotted defence network that Boron installed to keep Split out. Dispose of laser towers to allow for Split offensive.

Time has come for most noble task. Split want to move into enemy Boron space. In order to achieve this, Split need key Atreus Currents station razed. That is your responsibility. Will be hard fight, but good one.

Split need access to Boron station in order to extract valuable work force. However, their station defences are too strong right now. If Split approach, Split will be taken apart. Should the station's turrets be destroyed, Split can approach and board station with less risk.

Station: $STATION$
Amount of turrets to destroy: $TURRETS$

page.title: ATF vs Xenon War
page.descr: Texts for the 'ATF vs Xenon war' mission-group and sub-mission variants
page.t: The Community of Planet's irresponsible inaction in containing the Xenon has once again demonstrated that Sol can only be safe if the Terran Protectorate takes a proactive stance. We request that any able citizen of the Sol system reports to their designated representative. Furthermore, we also welcome any individual from outside Sol, as long as they prove to be capable.
These machines threaten everything we hold dear. It is crucial that we never budge, no matter the cost! Be vigilant! Destroy the enemy!
Despite our best efforts, the Xenon have been steadily approaching our borders and their numbers are rapidly growing.
Reconnaissance has picked up a significant number of Xenon ships heading right for the Sol system.

Our recent engagements with Xenon forces have resulted in massive losses on their side. However, this does not change the fact that there is still a significant Xenon presence right outside our borders.
Terran scouts have registered a large Xenon presence not too far from here. While their proximity is alarming, we now know where they are, which means we can engage them on our terms.

Our military has suffered heavy losses, and the Xenon are encroaching on Protectorate territory. We have to turn the tide while we still can. It is of vital importance that we re-establish a secure perimeter and set up our defences, or the Sol system will be overrun.
These machines just won't stop coming. Their sheer numbers are overwhelming. The consequences of Xenon ships slipping through our defences this close to Earth would be disastrous.
We simply cannot afford any holes in our line of defence. It needs to be air-tight.
This war has reached the point where any negligence could result in untold civilian lives lost. A solid defence has to be our immediate priority.
If we ever want to win this war, we have to make sure we have a stable base of operations. There cannot be any doubt about whether our defences will hold the Xenon at bay.

The Xenon fleet regularly attempts to intrude into our space, but our defence system is maintaining the battle line and decimating their numbers. Even so, we have to make sure that our defences are adequately prepared for any possible attack.

Our forces are continuing to clash with the Xenon. Right now, we have the advantage that we are fighting close to home, and we can use all of the defensive measures we have put in place to provide our pilots with backup.
It is our first priority to ensure that all protocols are in place, and all of our defensive systems are in working order.
You can help us with this immense task. Our work here, if done with diligence, will save many lives.
So far we have not been able to stop the Xenon advance. Unfortunately, we can no longer dismiss the possibility of having to engage them, here, in the Sol system.
So far, all attempts at defending against the Xenon have resulted in heavy losses. It has become painfully obvious that our defences are not adequate for the threat we are facing.
These recent developments have underlined the need for stronger security to be in place.
We ask anyone with the necessary capabilities to help by building defence stations and expanding our fleet, to aid us in our endeavour of creating a more secure Sol system.
Since the enemy is so close by, time is of the essence. It is crucial that anyone capable of helping us significantly increase our security, does so.

The Xenon fleets trying to gain entry into our territory are suffering from heavy attrition thanks to our valiant troops. We have to ensure that we support the troops by supplying replacements and fortifying their defences.
The Protectorate is renowned for its military supremacy. What people might not realise, though, is that it takes a lot of effort to maintain our fleets and defence stations.
Now, with the enemy at our gates, it is key that we act swiftly, and decisively.
It is for this reason that we must turn to outside help. If you can help deliver fleets or build defence stations, you are duty-bound to do so.
We are asking anyone experienced in ship or station construction to aid us in our task. Lives depend on it.
With the Xenon so close at hand, we had little option but to focus all of our attention on keeping them back. Now, that narrow focus has resulted in our supply lines coming under threat.
Unfortunately, the Xenon fleet's movement has caused some areas, specifically ones that the Protectorate usually relies on for resources, to become unavailable. This is unacceptable.
A resource shortage in this critical situation could lose the war and seal all our fates.

While we increase pressure on the Xenon fleet in an attempt to push it back from our borders, we need the help of someone who can identify new ways of procuring the required resources that fuel this war effort.

Resource availability has to become our second-largest focus, next to protecting our system from being overrun. Things are not looking good, and we need help with maintaining a reliable resource supply.

While our recent war efforts have been going well, Command is worried about potential supply shortages. Some of our usual ways of obtaining resources have become unavailable due to the shifting war front.

Thanks to the tremendous efforts of our troops, the Xenon are losing ground. We are steadily pushing them away from our borders. However, we are also worried that our current resource supplies might not be sufficent, should the Xenon launch a prolonged counter-offensive.
These resources are of critical importance in maintaining our fleet.

As such, it is important to ensure the supply of raw materials and resources. Outsourcing these urgent tasks would take a lot of pressure off of our own military. If you have the facilities, please consider taking up this responsibility.
The Xenon attacks are unrelenting. Our fleet is able to hold them off, but just barely. Anything that tips the scales in their favour might become a watershed moment, and our system could be overrun.

The fighting outside our borders has not let up. We are taking heavy casualties, and so are they. The battle lines have become very entrenched, and High Command does not like them to be drawn this close to home.
We need more room to manoeuvre. If we could ease the pressure, we could focus on rebuilding our defences, stocking up our supplies and starting to push back.
We need more fighters on our side. You would not have to beat back their entire fleet. It would suffice if you hit them enough to tip the scales back in our favour.
Right now, we need all the help we can get. Any combat pilot who is capable of inflicting casualties on the Xenon is welcome to join our efforts.
The results of our ongoing military campaign have far exceeded our expectations. We have a real opportunity to push the Xenon fleet away from our borders for good.
While it is worrying that the Xenon were ever able to establish a presence so close to our system in the first place, our fleet has done a tremendous job of keeping them in check.
If we can press our advantage, and do not let up, we will be able to regain ground currently occupied by the Xenon, and re-establish a safety zone between them and Sol.
If you are an experienced Pilot, we invite you to take part in this initiative. Destroy as many of these machines as you can. It will help turn the tides of war.

The Terran Secret Service is preoccupied with a number of operations outside Sol, so they have reached out and asked to outsource all intelligence work pertaining to the Xenon threat outside our borders.
Despite the worrying fact that the Xenon have established a presence close to our system, we do not have much actionable intelligence on their numbers, or their movements.

Accurate information is critical to waging a war. Especially if you are up against an enemy that, while fundamentally unpredictable, has at times displayed recognisable patterns. We can leverage that fact to our advantage.

With the Xenon having managed to gain a foothold so close to our home, we need any advantage we can get. Even in the face of superior technology, or a much larger fleet, almost any battle can be turned around through actionable intel.

There are tasks which will help improve the data we have gathered on the Xenon. Some of them might bring you into close contact with them, while others are less direct. They are all equally important to securing Terran space.
To be able to defend our system, we are dependent on capable pilots to map out the enemy territory, and gather as much intelligence as possible without them putting themselves at risk.

The military has been making good progress in pushing the Xenon away from our gates. However, we frequently lose ships due to a lack of information on enemy movement and fleet strength. This issue is quite unfortunate, but it can be addressed.

After much back and forth, the Protectorate has finally gained the upper hand, and can purge the Xenon outside their gates. However, in order to ensure all machines are located and properly dealt with, we need to gather more intelligence.
An increase in the quality and quantity of the information we gather could save Terran lives and help eradicate the Xenon presence going forward.
We have assembled a list of tasks that need to be fulfilled to improve our intel. You can help us establish the new network that will deliver this crucial information to our headquarters.

The Xenon have gained significant ground on us. It is simply unacceptable to cede control of our territory to them. For this reason, High Command has decreed the reclamation of lost ground to be our highest priority.
In fighting the enemy, our military has suffered heavy losses. For that reason, we ask that everyone, no matter what their specialisation, gets involved in our takeover efforts.
You do not have to be a brave combat pilot to leave a mark. You can transport officers to the front, or set up a defensive perimeter in the sector. All are duty-bound to do their part.
Through the united efforts of our valiant military branches, we have gained a position of strength over the Xenon. We have to press the advantage, and move forward into Xenon space.

Taking Xenon territory is a crucial objective on the path to winning this war. It will significantly weaken their forces, and each system we free from this scourge means one more layer of protection between us and them.
To ensure that this advance is a success, everyone who is capable of helping is urged to do their part. You can ferry officers, secure objectives or deliver supplies; it does make a difference!

We have suffered significant losses, and morale is waning. High Command is putting pressure on us to produce a victory to show to the Terran people. To that end we have identified a Xenon station of note.

We have identified a station, not far from our system, that supplies the Xenon fleet. If we were to tear it down, we would be able to slow the Xenon attacks, and potentially open up that system for a counter-offensive.
It has now become our top priority to take it down, not only to weaken the Xenon foothold in the system, but also to lift the spirits of our military cadets, and the civilian population.
Tearing down a hostile station is no small feat. This is why we only approach the most trusted and powerful of our allies to execute this operation.
Right now the situation is critical. If we do not take that station down, we might lose the war. Only our most powerful allies will be capable of helping us with this undertaking.

We have fought long and hard to secure our borders from the Xenon. It seems their attacks have grown less intense. Now, we have to seize the moment, first to significantly reduce their presence here, and then to push them away from our system.

We are able to defend ourselves quite well from the Xenon. A certain routine has set in, where our fighters know exactly how to engage them. The problem is, this status quo will not be broken if we do not change tack.
We must be coordinated, and strike the enemy with determination. We have to come together with the single purpose of destroying their Xenon station.
This task is only suitable for the most trusted, powerful allies of the Protectorate. However, should you succeed in tearing down the station, you will have significantly improved our situation.

The Xenon may have set up their base somewhere far from Sol, but that does not mean that we can turn a blind eye to the infestation. They continue to wreak havoc in the universe and, if left unchecked, they will only grow in numbers.
We need to hunt down the Xenon, no matter how far away from Earth they are holed up. We will not be safe until they no longer have any corner of the universe to call their own.
Our military is fighting them, no matter how far they have to travel to meet the Xenon in combat. Unfortunately, though, waging war so far from your stations represents a logistical challenge.

It is imperative that these fleets are supported out there. We cannot let them venture out into the unknown without adequate protection and supplies. We ask anyone who can, to make the journey and help our troops.
Since we cannot afford to divert our Sol-based fleets to support the war effort on the far end of the universe, we have to rely on recruiting a third party.
The Protectorate must carry the shining beacon of humanity into the deepest, darkest corners of the Gate network. Only then can we truly protect humanity.

When we were reconnected with the network, it soon became apparent that we had to take the fight to the Xenon systems, and that we had to disregard the Community of Planets' sovereignty to do so efficiently.
Since we cannot rely on any other organisations, it is challenging to supply and maintain a fleet that far out from home.
It is for this reason that we approach powerful allies such as yourself for help. We would pay well if you could help establish our first line of defence out there.

The Xenon are still overrunning systems and growing in strength. The fact that these systems are far outside our usual reach cannot matter. These machines will eventually find their way here, and they will leave a swathe of destruction in their path.

It is the nature of self-replicating machines that they will grow exponentially in both strength and number. It would be tempting to ignore those Xenon strongholds far away from Sol, but we cannot afford to ease off and rely on the Community of Planets to handle the threat appropriately.
Our fleets are currently tied up in border skirmishes with Xenon strays and pirate elements.
It is a challenge to establish a meaningful presence halfway across the universe, and should you help us in these endeavours, you would be handsomely rewarded for doing so.
Should you elect to aid us with this military operation in far-off space, the Protectorate would be eternally grateful.
The Terran Protectorate aims to carry the light of human ascendancy into the farmost reaches of space. To seek the Xenon menace and exterminate it is our most founding principle.
We have decisively beaten back the Xenon forces from our borders. As a result, we now have the resources to focus on more remote systems that have been overrun by the Xenon.
We are looking to establish a presence and to push out into hostile Xenon space. If we do not take this fight to them, we are dealing with the symptoms, but we are not treating the disease.
Due to the challenges of coordinating an operation this remote, we are looking for suitable partners to help us in our efforts.
We have compiled a list of tasks for you, should you wish to help the Protectorate cut through the remote Xenon haunts.
Our reports indicate that the Xenon are amassing in large numbers in a distant system. It is only a matter of time before they make their way to Sol.

When the Gates reconnected, our leaders proclaimed that the Protectorate was going to become the absolute authority on protecting and policing the Gate network. We intend to fulfil our pledge. Our next target is going to be a distant Xenon system, far from Earth.

These Xenon fleets may be far away, but they are not outside the Protectorate's grasp. It is our intention to whittle down their numbers long before they find their way to the Sol system and become a threat to the Terran people.
While the Protectorate does not need help, it is a good opportunity for you to prove your mettle by assisting our fleet in this offensive operation.
Since this operation will take place in a remote location, without the ability to quickly respond and send backup, we offer experienced Pilots such as yourself the opportunity to aid us.
We are currently preparing an offensive into faraway Xenon territory. Too long has the Community of Planets turned a blind eye to the forces of destruction growing in its midst.
The Xenon have been growing stronger in far-off systems, undisturbed by the other inhabitants of the Jump Gate network.
If we want the Xenon menace dealt with, we have to be proactive and do it ourselves. Unfortunately, there is no other way.

If you are an experienced Pilot, we invite you to join this operation. Disrupting the enemy on their home turf is our primary objective. Whittle down the Xenon numbers, and show the other factions how it is done.

It takes a tremendous amount of effort and coordination to supply a Terran fleet out there. We have to ensure that our valiant troops are well equipped. Help us to supply them with provisions so that they can keep the universe safe.

A well-stocked armoury is the key to beating back these soulless machines. Supplies also help to assemble and maintain our vast fleets. The Protectorate hopes that you can help transport resources to the areas in which they are needed.

Maintaining a secure perimeter takes a lot of effort. Laser Towers are often the very first things that get damaged or destroyed during a Xenon invasion, yet they are critical in slowing down the enemy and holding them off. Please see to it that our perimeter is well defended.

Since the Xenon are machines at their core, they will always exhibit a certain amount of predictable behaviour. Our military can capitalise on that fact by laying minefields to deny them easy access to strategic positions. We could really use a hand in deploying these mines.

We have had notable success in cutting down enemy attacks through strategically placed minefields. If they do not destroy a fleet outright, they will usually slow them down enough for us to initiate a counterattack. As such, it is important to continuously expand our network of minefields.

The Xenon have repeatedly attempted to access resource fields located within our jurisdiction; resource fields which we are relying on to keep our economy running, and our fleets stocked. We need to shore up our defences and ensure they cannot access these fields. Deploying Laser Towers should be an efficient deterrence.

Far too often have Xenon attacks caught us off-guard. While none of their attacks so far have been able to penetrate all of our defences and find their way to Earth, we cannot risk them taking us by surprise. Help us to improve the quality of our intel by enhancing our satellite system.

When our fleets invade Xenon space, we want to make sure that they are secured along their flanks. One straightforward way of offering protection is to install Laser Towers in the Xenon system. You, too, can help the Terran Protectorate to prepare for our next offensive by deploying these front-line Laser Towers.

Our combat analysts have reviewed multiple data sources, and concluded that the presence of Laser Towers in combat areas has a positive effect on the outcome of the battle. Based on this, the Protectorate has developed an initiative which aims at deploying Laser Towers in any potential theatre of war.

Creating minefields in Xenon territory may not be the one thing that will end this war, but deploying them still reliably slows down Xenon supply ships, and disrupts their routines. Attrition is a considerable factor in any war, and therefore tasks like these, even if they seem menial, are vitally important.

The Community of Planets has shown themselves to be very reluctant to deploy minefields in order to protect themselves from Xenon attacks. The Protectorate does not hesitate to employ mines in order to inflict damage on Xenon fleets. Any Xenon ship taken out by mines is a ship we do not have to engage in combat.

Ideally, the Terran Protectorate would be aware of the enemy's movements before they even finish mobilising their fleets. In order to achieve that, though, we need Satellites in their territory. Deploying Satellites this close to the enemy can be dangerous, so stay watchful.

While the Protectorate's attention is always focused on the Terran border, along with any systems that have been overrun by the Xenon, it is important not to lose sight of our own back yard. Having an already established satellite network would prove very useful in the case of the Xenon actually pushing into this system. Please make sure that we are adequately covered by the Satellites.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Our Satellites do not last long in Xenon territory. The enemy will actively seek them out, and destroy them. Despite their fragility, the Satellites' intel is invaluable to the war effort. Your task, therefore, is to enter enemy space and replace those that have been lost.\n$REQUIREMENTS$

Clashes with Xenon forces routinely leave ships in our fleet damaged. Our military fleets have grown to such a size that maintaining them and repairing them after battle has become a genuine challenge. That is why we have asked our allies to help out with the repairs.

We have received a distress call requesting the repair of a ship which has been stranded far outside our sphere of influence. They have been ambushed by the Xenon and, while they were able to escape, they are now sitting out in the open without adequate defences. Since the ship is some distance from our nearest available support units, we have delegated this urgent matter to you.
Help Assemble our Best and Brightest

The Sol system has always been renowned for its citizens' fighting spirit. It comes as no surprise, therefore, that the military is rarely short of motivated, skilled young cadets, itching to get in on the action. So many, in fact, that it can be hard to coordinate their transport. So, we need your help in bringing them all together.
As you may be aware, the Protectorate is fighting the Xenon on remote fronts. We have recently suffered casualties and need to bolster our numbers. Aid us in shuttling our marines to the war front.

Our primary line of defence will always be strategically placed Defence Stations. They are instrumental in keeping the enemy fleets at bay. We need to increase the number of Defence Stations in our system, and we want you to help build a station that fits our specifications.

The Protectorate is not the only power waging war against the Xenon. These machines are a blight on all races of the network. Since our military superiority affords us a unique position, we have to aggressively expand our bases into distant systems to help keep the Xenon in check. Build a station that fits our specifications.

We are looking to establish a presence in a hostile Xenon system. Before we engage the enemy, however, we need more information about that system, especially with regard to its resource fields. With a working knowledge of the area, we can quickly establish supply lines that will keep our fleet well stocked. We need you to find high-yield regions containing the following resource: $WARENAMES$

The Terran Protectorate is conducting an offensive operation into Xenon territory. We demand that our allies support this operation in any way possible.

The Protectorate is always in need of capable pilots, willing to lay down their lives for Sol. There are plenty of skilled pilots out there, but capable pilots with this kind of fervent dedication are harder to come by. So, should you know of any such pilots, we ask you to deliver them to us for cadet school.
We are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\)
$DESTINATION$
$SKILLS$

We have to ensure that the military installations facing the Xenon are functional at all times. The Protectorate is looking for $NPCCOUNT$ engineer\(s\) to be brought to our station. Experience in maintaining weapons systems is mandatory.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

In order to aid the other factions' fight against the Xenon, the Protectorate has offered to provide specialist military training in return for foreign policy concessions. The Protectorate is especially looking for skilled pilots who can teach our friends how to fight the Xenon. Bring any applicable candidates to the allied station.
We are looking for $NPCCOUNT$ pilot\(s\) to train their forces.
$DESTINATION$
$SKILLS$

It is not always possible for us to maintain our fleets that are fighting the Xenon in systems that are far remote from Sol. For this reason that we have arranged for Terran Protectorate Engineers to be assigned on allied stations, so that they can help maintain far-off ships.\n$DESTINATION$\n$SKILLS$

The Protectorate is preparing a fleet to meet the Xenon forces head-on. The fleet has to be sizeable enough to protect Sol's borders from this, and any future, threat. You can help our war effort by binging the following ships to $SECTOR$ :\n$FLEET$

We are planning to invade Xenon territory some considerable distance from Sol. For that, we need to gather a fleet. Aid us in assembling this fleet by bringing the following ships to $SECTOR$ :\n$FLEET$

In order to adequately fight off Xenon forces, our stations need to be well stocked. Without medical equipment, ammunition and miscellaneous other supplies, our fighters cannot inflict the damage they ought to.\n\nThe station concerned requests that their resource levels are raised above: $STORAGEPERCENT$%

Our intelligence officers have observed a Xenon fleet of impressive size that seems to be gearing up for an invasion. We need you to preemptively weaken their fleet by reducing their numbers. Our specialists have identified one type of ship type specifically, whose absence would weaken the approaching fleet.\nHunt down Xenon ships with the following specification:\n$SHIP$

We believe we may have identified a structural flaw in the Xenon ships' hulls. If we could gather more data to confirm our findings, we could adapt our combat protocols accordingly. Scan a Xenon ship to gather the crucial data.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$

The Protectorate is preparing an offensive into Xenon territory. Before we commit to the assault, we need to know exactly what it is that we are facing, however. Scan a Xenon station so that we can analyse what we will be up against.\n\nTarget reveal percentage: $PERCENT$

Recently, the Xenon fleet's behaviour seems to have changed, and our specialists are puzzled as to why. We suspect that it might be connected to the nearby station's layout. If we can find any aberrations, perhaps we could use any newfound insights to our advantage.\n\nYou need to scan the following module: $MODULE$

Based on our observations, we are expecting Xenon ship production to rise in the near future. Since they are not rational beings, the best indicator of their battle plans is what wares they convey, and which stations they supply. Help us determine their plans.\n\n Find a Xenon ship containing: $WARE$

For reasons we cannot divulge due to your lack of security clearance, the Terran Secret Service is interested in tracking one specific Xenon ship. We need to know its whereabouts at all times. Please, locate that Xenon ship for us. The ship in question has ID code $IDCODE$

We want to identify and trace the Xenon supply line so that we can efficiently sabotage it by strategically placing minefields and having Terran fleets patrol the route. Anything that disrupts their fleet production will help us in the long run. You can aid us in this endeavour by scanning a ship transporting Hull Parts.

We have to know where exactly the Xenon obtain their raw resources from. If we can trace their supply routes, we can ambush their ships and slow down their growth. To achieve that, all you have to do is scan ships transporting Ore.

The Protectorate is always in need of water supplies. Since we intend to push the Xenon out of their system, and then hold it, we need to know where in that system the Xenon obtain their water supply. You can help us identify the source by scanning ships transporting Water.

In preparation for the upcoming military campaign, we need to make sure that we have easy access to Xenon systems. They are known to impede access by placing mines. You are ordered to seek out the minefield and destroy the mines which would slow us down.

We have lost too many pilots to carelessness. It is a challenge to be aware of your surroundings at all times when engaging in dogfights with the enemy. Often, solitary mines are overlooked. To reduce the risk of unnecessary casualties, we ask you to remove these mines swiftly, before we engage the Xenon again.

In order to secure the fleet's next foray, we have to send a team of ships solely dedicated to removing Laser Towers. They might not be able to destroy a fleet on their own, but in a fight with another fleet, they could make all the difference.
While our forces rally to prepare a big assault on Xenon space, we need people to fly ahead and clear the way for our valiant fighters. Will you help us destroy the Xenon Laser Towers?

It is time to focus the Protectorate's entire attention on the Xenon stations threatening all citizens of Sol. We need you to destroy this station. Doing so, although admittedly a challenge, would greatly impact this war against the machines.

We have to get a team of scientists close to a Xenon station in order to conduct an investigation. The issue is that the station's defences would tear us apart long before we even managed to set up our equipment. If you could destroy the station's turrets in preparation for our arrival, we would be able to conduct our research, and potentially identify weaknesses in the Xenon stations' design.

Station: $STATION$
Number of turrets to destroy: $TURRETS$

diff.replace: A famous hub of technical expertise before the Jump Gate shutdown, thanks largely to the people stationed there to stop the influx of Xenon activity from neighbouring Xenon Sector 472, {20003,60001} now enjoys an extended era of peace. Still, its people have remained busy, attempting to build a self-sufficient community in case history repeats itself.\n\nThough the system finds itself cut off from Argon Federation space and under the authority of the Antigone Republic however the Argon Federation provides a steady stream of supplies desperate to show that no colony of theirs will be left to fend for itself even if no longer under their authority.

While the Black Hole Sun(same as {20003,60001}) system found itself in a comparatively stable situation after the Jump Gate shutdown, thanks to the cessation of Xenon incursions, the people of this sector are still subject to frequent piracy. Before the shutdown, pirates used to go out of their way to take upon themselves the arduous journey into the system, enticed by the rich pickings its remote position and instability provided. Nowadays, cut off from the other Argon systems, under the loose authority of the Antigone Republic, and situated in close proximity to both Teladi and Syndicate space, this sector makes for an even more attractive target.
Heavier than a Destroyer, ships of this class are far better better against capital ships and stations but are extremely vulnerable to smaller ships.
